titles.title: Promoting Free and Fair Elections Act of 2023
Promoting Free and Fair Elections Act of 2023
Promoting Free and Fair Elections Act of 2023
To limit the involvement of Federal agencies in voter registration activities, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committees on the Judiciary, Oversight and Accountability, Science, Space, and Technology, and Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 5 - 4.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on House Administration. H. Rept. 118-577, Part I.
Committee on Oversight and Accountability discharged.
Committee on Science, Space, and Technology discharged.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 478.

committee.name: House Committee on House Administration
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

bill.summary:
Safeguarding Electoral Integrity Act of 2023
This bill prohibits federal agencies from using funds made available for salaries and expenses to solicit or enter into agreements with nongovernmental organizations to conduct voter registration or voter mobilization activities on the agency's property or website.
The bill also nullifies Executive Order 14019 (which established requirements for expanding access to voter registration and election information) and terminates any contracts entered into under specified provisions of the order.
Each agency must, within 30 days, submit a report to specified congressional committees that describes the voter registration and mobilization activities carried out by the agency pursuant to this executive order.
The bill also prohibits institutions of higher education that operate federal work-study programs from registering or mobilizing voters on or off campus.
